comments.commentBody: clarification: " fewest net jobs percentage-wise ".
They don't have to win. There is enough money simply in running to keep them rolling in the dough for years to come.

Perhaps then, the Indian Government and the UN can step in and relieve the distress of millions of destitute people who live in India 'between the tracks' whilst the Indian Government is indulging in space exploration.

Perhaps they can, at the same time, do something about the current waves of attacks upon young girls in open places such as on buses and the murder of the victims by hanging on trees for all to see their plight.

I would suggest, Sir, that you get your own house in order before pontificating on the 'compassion' of Angela Merkel when all she and the EU Commission are doing is to precipitate social breakdown to indigenous European culture in order to bolster the formation of a European 'Superstate' and to bolster their fading European Project. Where was German compassion when it further 'crucified' the already destitute Greek economy?

Notwithstanding some protesting voices and reservations  in the central and eastern parts,  the kind of an overall compassionate humanitarian response under the guidance of German Chancellor Angela Merkel and rest of the EU leadership that has been forged to meet the heavy refugee influx is not only unprecedented but exemplary for rest of the global community, specially the UN, which should swing into action fast now to mitigate this humanitarian catastrophe caused by futile wars,  persecution, and widespread poverty in some parts of the world.

Et tu? Glad to see someone else had the same experience I did. I had trouble with the north and headed south. Got the revealer right away and just figured- okay, theme clues just spill over.

Read Deb's comments and had to laugh at myself. Yup. I used to feel dumb when something like this occurs. Now I just accept the fact that I am a little challenged when theme recognition is involved.

Professor Krugman, have you read the Jeb tax plan?

It is too informed by his Florida experience. In a grammatical fragment: benefitting the wealthy elderly and cutting services back to bare bones so that everyone feels a need to carry a pistol with them! (And they shoot them, too.)
Plus where is the analysis of full employment in either economy.

Right, DH. But isn't it amazing how bad he turned out to be! His brother and dad weren't electrifying personalities, but compared to Jeb! they are both scintillating. As I often tell people, Jeb! is to speechmaking what gravediggers are to gardening.
Unfortunately, most NYT readers will take the opinion of a partisan, like Paul Krugman, as gospel and run with it.

Greek good of running--LO-PE.

I've always thought it was strange that the Hawaiian volcano goddess is Pele. She's no relation to Mount Pelée which erupted in 1902, killing 30,000.
Don't make me come down to Durham, Robert. ;)

Go ahead, Robert! Make Deb come down to Durham!!

Party time.

I can't stop. I've tried. Greek God of mini skirts: OB-SCE_NE (OB-SEE-KNEE)

There was a FLY in the JAM, and almost a COB SALAD.
Not delusion.  That would imply craziness or a mental disorder.  The man and those who rule Iran are Islamists.  They will not be Kombia'd out of their perspective.
Yes, and he IS also the leader of a large and soon to be incredibly powerful country. How does one not take such threats seriously?
The Ayatollah is simply delusional.  His statements aren't grounded in any reality, merely fanatical opinions.
Seems highly unlikely that the majority of Iran's population favors mutually assured destruction.
And increasing its pariah status not to mention-the way it treats its Arab citizens-let alone the Palestinians.
Israeli Arabs are treated better in Israel than are the Arab citizens of *any* other Mideast country.
if arabs/palestinians loved their children more than they hate Israeli children, then there would be peace (Golda Meir)
Israel will be in the Middle East long after the Ayatollah is gone
There,is a very old saying. They are all the ones sows pigs.

They Ayatollah's comment about Israel's future lifespan reminds of me Khrushchev's famous prediction about the short future of the US. If Israel and Palestine ever come to terms, then they're in OK shape.

And Khamenei's showing his age when he says “Officials of the country must respect the revolutionary young people and stop degrading them, saying they are extremist.”

The young extremists who followed your predecessor and took over the US Embassy aren't kids, anymore, your Grandness. That was many years ago.

the link from which the extract came ...

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/aug/23/baby-crisis-europe-brink-de...

do you take seriously the talk of this man? there are prominent (or at least publicized) americans who usually make little sense. it would be a mistake to take this one impression and call it iranian reality. like the blind people giving their description of the elephant, people who use this one statement as their only information about iran will likely remain ignorant about this very young population born well after the revolution and hostage crisis we angrily remember.

It is not just the US that negotiated with Iran. The 5p +1 countries, China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States; plus Germany have agreed to the final resolution. If the US does not follow up then they will be a laughing stock to the rest of the world. Already France, Russia and other countries are dealing with Iran.
It's not too late for the misguided senators who support this travesty to change their minds. The Iranians are kind enough to give us a warning. How foolish can we be not to heed it.

A much more likely scenario is that Iran will develop suitcase nuclear bombs and put them in the hands of terrorists who will try to explode them in the middle of Tel Aviv and Jerusalem killing tens of thousands.

Stuart,
Do you think Bibi could ever be elected Prime Minister without his creation of the Iranian Boogieman to deflect his abysmal domestic economic record?
Much like the US and Canada Israel's greatest threat is internal and that threat are those that sponsor fear and paranoia as opposed to finding solutions to the all too real problems of a very changed economy.
I think of the posters we had on the walls as teenagers- Bo Derek and Farah come to mind.  In Iran they had posters of bearded angry old men.  I think we got a better deal.

Yes, Khamenei remains a fierce opponent of Israel. But that doesn't mean Iran has, or ever would have, the capability of threatening the existence of Israel. The Israeli military, whose powers are soon to be augmented by even more US aid, outmatches all other Middle Eastern nations combined. In the real world, notwithstanding right-wing Israeli manufactured hysteria, Iran is not a threat to Israel. Nothing suggests the Iranian right-wingers are crazy (I wish I could say the same about the US right), and Israel's possession of a formidable nuclear deterrent means that Iranians would be committing national suicide were they to make one or two bombs and attack Israel with them. Why should we think they care enough about Israel to destroy their own country in order to eliminate Israel? Is there any evidence that this is how anyone in Iran thinks, let alone those in power?

It's also worth mentioning that whatever Khamenei may say, he is not totally in control of events, and it is entirely possible that the US and Iran could achieve a normal relationship in the next 15 years, should the US cease to fulfill predictions that it is an anti-Islamic power determined to control the Middle East.
Not to mention John "Bomb, Bomb, Bomb" McCain...!

What a sad sack loser. Even his own people can't stand him. He and his Revolutionary Guard are walking a little gingerly having just been neutered by the new nuclear accord. It must be really eating at him. Good. Israel has not only survived much more than Iran could ever threaten, but has prospered, and will continue to do so.

In Islam, Satan is not the personification of evil that he is in Christianity. He is a "whisperer", encouraging men to yield to evil temptations. Khamenei and his cohort see American culture as a threat to their extreme conservative religious agenda. This is the source of the "Great Satan" rhetoric.

Khamenei has every reason to fear that his people - especially the young - will eventually drift away from extreme Islam and embrace a more tolerant Westernized lifestyle. That's why he hates America, though he would be comforted if he could see the throngs of American Christianists demonstrating in favor of Kim Davis' religion-driven bigotry. Birds of a feather.
Isn't it obvious? Vitriol is all he has left. His nuclear days are over, and it's killing him.
Without superhuman adversaries the rule of the clerics would quickly disappear.
Consider such statements as attempts to mollify hard-line conservatives in the government and military.

This kind of talk does NOT even remotely help Iran's foreign policy position. Talk like this only plays into the darkest fears and conspiracy theories of both the US and Israeli Right Wing war mongers. It adds to the distrust of all parties.

Poorly considered and stated at best. Sometimes it's best to say nothing at all...
There is no evidence that the oppressive government will give up power. The US has won nothing in this deal. It is not a treaty, by the way, which would need ratification by the US Congress.
There is no evidence that he will give up power.

You are correct about one thing, Iran is not Iraq.  Iran is a major sponsor of terrorism across the world.  Iranian backed terrorist organizations have been responsible for the deaths of hundreds of Americans.  Currently, they are providing significant financial and military aid to Assad, Hamas, Hezbollah and the Houthis.  Iraq has no oil, no money is is not a global sponsor of terrorists.

My goodness, what a lot of reason for war. The Grand Leader is being deliberately provocative. Iran won't have the means to act in the fashion that so many fear. If you would like to see the ruin of the west so soon then by all means attack. Look behind the stagecraft. Iran is not a threat to it's neighbors let alone these United States. Look at the human disaster that was the Iraq war. That was when there was relative stability in the area. Now half the area is in chaos and an attack, For No Good Reason, on Iran, will drown Europe. Not to mention the dark people.

We have already created conditions for for disaster how can we charge in and make it worse. Iran Is no more a danger than was Iraq. We have no experience of this kind of population displacement here in the US. Maybe that is why we don't care.

And what in your opinion is the "Palestinian issue"?  To people living in Israel it means a dispute over territory where they have been  living under constant terror everyday since 1948 with many Israeli lives lost despite the fact  land they live on is rightfully theirs.
